groups.english: The Verses of the Eight Noble Auspicious Ones
It is very important to recite this through once before starting on any activity; whatever the project, it will work out exactly as you wish.
Homage to the Buddha, Dharma and Noble Sangha,
groups.phonetics: Om Nangsi namtak rangzhin lhüntrup pé

groups.english: All that dwell in the Auspicious realms of the ten directions,
Where all appearance and existence is completely pure, its nature spontaneously perfect;
May all be auspicious for us!
Think of us, Saviour-King and Enduring-Power-Wish-Fulfiller,
Sublime Glorious-Ornament-of-Love and Excellence-of-Fame-and-Virtue,
Widely-Renowned-Who-Cares-for-All,
Glorious-Power-Exalted-as-Mount-Meru,
Splendour-of-Fame-Who-Cares-for-All-Beings,
And Legendary-Skill-Satisfying-All-Desires,
Homage to you, Eight Sugatasi;
Merely hearing your names increases auspiciousness and success!
Gentle-Glorious-Youth, noble Vajra-Bearer,
Powerful-One-of-Compassionate-Gaze, Protector Infinite-Love,
Essence-of-Earth, Dispeller-of-Obscurations,
Essence-of-Space and most noble All-Good,
You who gracefully hold as emblems the Utpala flower, vajra, white lotus, naga-tree,
Jewel, moon, sword and sun,
And are supreme in granting auspiciousness and success!
Homage to you, Eight Bodhisattvas!
The most precious Umbrella, the Auspicious Golden Fishes,
The Wishfulfilling Vase of Goodness, the exquisite Kamala flower,
The Conch of Fame, the Glorious Knot of Prosperity,
The Eternal Banner of Victory and the Wheel of Dominion!
These are the Eight Most Precious Emblems you hold.
You creators of delight, making offerings to the Buddhas of all directions and times,
Homage to you, Eight Auspicious Goddesses, Goddess of Enchantment and the others!
Merely thinking of your essential qualities makes success grow more and more!
Great-Perfect-One, Source-of-Happines, Son-of-No-Craving,
Thousant-Eyes and the kings Protector-of-Land-and-Retinue,
Noble-Birth, Poor-Sighted (lord of the Nagas),
And Son-of-Learned-One, each of you holding your divine emblem!
Wheel, trident, lance, vajra,
Vina, sword, stupa and banner of victory!
Homage to you, Eight Guardians of the World,
Who make auspiciousness and positivity grow in the three realms!
May the work we are now about to begin
Be free from all abstacles and imminent dangers,
And, meeting with ever-growing fulfilment and success,
Bring good fortune, prosperity, happiness and peace!

groups.tibetan: ལྡང་ཚེ་བརྗོད་ན་དེ་ཉིན་དོན་ཀུན་འགྲུབ། ཉལ་ཚེ་བརྗོད་ན་རྨི་ལམ་བཟང་པོ་མྠོང་། གཡུལ་དུ་འཇུག་ཚེ་བརྗོད་ན་ཕྱོགས་ལས་རྒྱལ། བྱ་བ་རྩོམ་དུས་བརྗོད་ན་འདོད་དོན་འཕེལ། རྒྱུན་དུ་བརྗོད་ན་ཚེ་དཔལ་གྲགས་འབྱོར་སྤེལ། བདེ་ལེགས་ཕུན་ཚོགས་བསམ་དོན་ཡིད་བཞིན་འགྲུབ། སྡིག་སྒྲིབ་ཀུན་བྱང་མངོན་མཐོ་ངེས་ལེགས་ཀྱི། དོན་ཀུན་འགྲུབ་པར་རྒྱལ་བ་མཆོག་གིས་གསུངས། རབ་ཚེས་མེ་སྤྲེལ་ཟླ༥་ཚེས༣་ལ་གཟའ་ཉི་མ་དང་རྒྱུ་སྐར་རྒྱལ་གྱི་དུས་བཟང་པོའི་ཆ་ལ་འཇམ་དཔལ་དགྱེས་པའི་རྡོ་རྗེའི་ཡིད་མཚོ་ལས་བྱུང་བ་ནོར་བུའི་དོ་ཤལ་ཆེན་པོ་སརྦ་མངྒལཾ༎  ༎
groups.english: The sublime Conqueror said that if one recites this prayer when one gets up, one will achieve all one’s aims that day; if one recites it before going to sleep, one will have good dreams; if one recites it as one enters into battle, one will be victorious in every respect; if one recites it when one begins a project, one’s plans will succeed; if one recites it daily one’s lifespan, success, fame and wealth will increase, one will accomplish one’s aims exactly as one has planned and find perfect happiness; all negative actions and obscurations will be purified and all one’s desires for the highest temporal and ultimate happiness will be fulfilled. This is a great garland of jewels which rose out of the oceanic mind of Jampel Gyepai Dorje (Mipham Rinpoche) at a perfect time, the third day of the fifth month, a Sunday, in the Fire Monkey year, at an auspicious moment when the constellation of the Victor was dominant. Sarwa mangalam!
The Sutra of Truly Remembering the Sublime Three Jewels
Homage to the Omniscient One!
Purified and Consummate, Victorious, Virtuous and Transcendent, Thus-Gone, Foe-destroying, entirely perfect Buddha, full of wisdom and the feet of wisdom,
groups.phonetics: Ditar sang-gyé chomden dété zhinshek padra chompa yangtak pardzok pésang gyérik patang zhapsu denpa

groups.english: The Blissfully Proceeding, the Knower of the World,
Charioteer and Subduer of beings,
The Unsurpassable, the teacher of Gods and Men,
groups.phonetics: La-na mépa Lhatang minam kyitön pa

groups.english: Such is Buddha, Victorious, Virtuous and Transcendent.
He who is Thus-Gone exemplifies the merit of which is his cause;
groups.phonetics: Tézhin shekpa téni sönam tak-ki gyuthün pa

groups.english: In him no root of virtue is ever worn away;
Through his manifold practice he is excellently beautiful.
He is the treasure-ground of merit;
Adorned with the tokens of Enlightenment,
He is graced with the flowers of the marks of Buddhahood.
All he does is seasonable and opportune
And nothing inharmonious mars the sight of him.
True joy indeed he gives to those who open their hearts to him in faith.
Through the brilliance of his wisdom he is unconfounded
And against his power there is no victory.
He is the teacher of all living beings,
The father of all Bodhisattvas,
The king of all Superior Ones,
He is the guide of those who journey to the city of Beyond Affliction.
groups.phonetics: Nya-ngen lédé pétrong khyertu drowa namkyi tépön

groups.english: His wisdom is unbounded, his assurance is beyond imagining.
groups.phonetics: Yéshé paktu mépa Pop-pa samkyi mikhyap pa

groups.english: His speech is altogether pure, well tuned and sweet to hear.
Gazing on him one is never sated; his body is beyond compare.
groups.phonetics: Kuché tawé chömi shépa Kutsung pamé pa

groups.english: By the realm of desire he is unstained,
And by the realm of form he is wholly uncontaminated;
He is not mingled with the formless.
He is altogether free from misery,
And from the aggregates he is utterly and altogether free.
He has mastery of the sense powers.
The elements have no hold on him;
All bonds he has completely severed
And from all pain he is perfectly and totally released.
No craving does he have; he has passed beyond the Stream.
groups.phonetics: Sépa létröl wa Chuwo léla wa

groups.english: Perfect is his wisdom;
And in the wisdom of the Buddhas past, present
And to come, he has made his dwelling.
groups.phonetics: Tatar chungwé sang-gyé chomden dénam kyiyé shéla népa

groups.english: In nirvana where all suffering is transcended he does not abide;
His abode is in the very summit of perfection,
Residing in that place whence he perceives all living beings.
groups.phonetics: Semchen thamchen lazik pésa lazhuk paté

groups.english: Such are the sublime qualities which are the greatness of the Buddha, Victorious, Virtuous and Transcendent.
groups.phonetics: Ditak nisang gyéchom dendé kyiku chéwé yönten yangtak pa-nam so

groups.english: The Sacred Doctrine is righteous in the outset,
Righteous in the middle, righteous in the end;
In its meaning excellent and in its words and syllables likewise.
It is integral and unalloyed; it is all-sufficing,
Altogether pure and purifying.
Well spoken is this Dharma by the Victorious, Virtuous and Transcendent. It is a perfect way of seeing,
groups.phonetics: Chomden dékyi chölek parsung payang takpar thongwa

groups.english: And is devoid of ailment; it is perennial and leads us onward.
groups.phonetics: Némé pa Tüché pamé pa Nyéwar töpa

groups.english: To see this Dharma is to fulfil one’s purpose;
It produces in the wise the wisdom all-distinguishing.
groups.phonetics: Khépa namkyi sosor rangki rikpar chawa

groups.english: The Dharma spoken by the Victorious, Virtuous and Transcendent is shown to be well-tempered to the instruction and needs of all.
groups.phonetics: Chomden dékyi sungpé chödül pala lekpar tönpa

groups.english: It drives one from samsara and causes one to go to perfect Buddhahood.
groups.phonetics: Ngépar jungwa Dzokpé changchup tudro parché pa

groups.english: It is free from contradiction and in it all is summarized.
It is totally to be relied upon; it is a cutting of the root.
The Sangha of the Mahayana comprises those who have well entered,
groups.phonetics: Thekpa chenpö gendün nilek parzhuk pa

groups.english: Wisely entered, entered with straightforwardness
And aptitude. Right it is to join one’s hands before them,
groups.phonetics: Thünpar zhukpa Thalmo jarwé ösu kyurpa

groups.english: And right to make prostration.
They are a glorious field of merit. They are the perfect recipients of gifts; they are the object of offering;
groups.phonetics: Sönam kyipal kyizhing yönyong sujong pachen pojin péné sukyur pa

groups.english: Everywhere and always they are the worthy object of offering.
groups.phonetics: Küntu yangjin péné sukyur pachen po-o

groups.english: Protector endowed with great compassion,
Omniscient one who guide us,
The field of an ocean of qualities and virtue,
I bow to the Tathagata.
The cause of purity free from attachement,
Through its virtue liberating us from the lower realms
And making what is ultimate and supreme as one,
I bow to the Dharma that brings peace.
Also showing the path of liberation from liberation
With extreme respect for the pure training,
Holy field endowed with qualities,
I bow also to the Sangha.
I bow to the principal one, the Buddha.
I bow to the protector, the Dharma.
I bow to the community, the Sangha.
To the three I bow with respect, always.
The qualities of the Buddha are inconceivable,
The qualities of the Dharma are inconceivable,
The qualities of the Sangha are inconceivable, and
The perfect ripening of creating faith in the inconceivable
Is also inconceivable.
May we arise in the perfectly pure fied.
The Sutra of the Heart of Transcendent Knowledge
Thus have I heard.
Once the Blessed One was dwelling in Rajagrha at Vulture Peak mountain, together with a great gathering of the sangha of monks
groups.phonetics: Chomden dégyal pökhap chagö p'ungpö rila gélong kigendün chenpo tang

groups.english: And a great gathering of the sangha of bodhisattvas.
groups.phonetics: Changchup sempé gendün chenpo tangthap chiktu zhukté

groups.english: At that time the Blessed One entered the samadhi that expresses the dharma called “profound illumination,”
groups.phonetics: Tétsé chomden désap mo-nang pazhé chawé chökyi namtrang kyiting ngédzin la-nyom parzhuk so

groups.english: And at the same time noble Avalokitesvara, the bodhisattva mahasattva, while practicing the profound prajñaparamita, saw in this way: he saw the five skandhas to be empty of nature.
groups.phonetics: Yangté tséchang chupsem pasem pachen pop'ak pachenrézi wangchuk shérap kyip'a röltu chinpa sapmö chöpa nyila nampar tazhing p'ungpo ngapo tétak layang rangzhin kyitong parnam parta-o

groups.english: Then, through the power of the Buddha, venerable Sariputra said to noble Avalokitesvara, the bodhisattva mahasattva,
groups.phonetics: Téné sang-gyé kyithü Tsétang denpa shari püchang chupsem pasem pachen pop'ak pachenrézi wangchuk ladi kéché méso

groups.english: “How should a son or daughter of noble family train, who wishes to practice the profound prajñaparamita?”
groups.phonetics: Rik-kyi pu-am rik-kyi pumo kangla lashé rapkyi p'aröl tuchin pasap möchö paché pardö paté chitar lap-par cha

groups.english: Addressed in this way, noble Avalokitesvara, the bodhisattva mahasattva, said to venerable Sariputra,
groups.phonetics: Téké chémé patang Changchup sempa semchen pop'ak pachenrézi wangchuk kitsé tangden pasha rata tipu ladi kéché méso

groups.english: “O Sariputra, a son or daughter of noble family who wishes to practice the profound prajñaparamita should see in this way:
groups.phonetics: Shari purik kyipu-am Rik-kyi pumo kangla lashé rapkyi p'aröl tuchin pasap möchö paché pardö paté ditar nampar tawar chaté

groups.english: Seeing the five skandha to be empty of nature.
groups.phonetics: P'ungpo ngapo tétak kyangrang zhinkyi tongpar nampar yangtak parjé suta-o

groups.english: Form is empty; Emptiness also is form.
Emptiness is no other than form;
Form is no other than emptiness.
In the same way, feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness are empty.
groups.phonetics: Tézhin tutsor patang Dushé tang Duché tang Nampar shépa namtong pa-o

groups.english: Thus, Sariputra, all dharmas are emptiness. There are no characteristics.
groups.phonetics: Shari pu Tétar chötham chétong pa-nyi té Tsen-nyi mépa

groups.english: There is no birth and no cessation.
There is no impurity and no purity. There is no decrease and no increase.
groups.phonetics: Trima mépa Trima tangtral wa Triwa mépa Kangwa mépa-o

groups.english: Therefore, Sariputra, in emptiness, there is no form,
groups.phonetics: Shari pu Téta péna tongpa nyila zukmé

groups.english: No feeling, no perception, no formation, no consciousness;
groups.phonetics: Tsorwa mé Dushé mé Duché mé Nampar shépa mé

groups.tibetan: མིག་མེད། རྣ་བ་མེད༑ སྣ་མེད། ལྕེ་མེད། ལུས་མེད། ཡིད་མེད།
groups.english: No eye, ne ear, no nose, no tongue, no body, no mind;
groups.phonetics: Mikmé Nawa mé Namé Chémé Lümé Yimé

groups.tibetan: གཟུགས་མེད། སྒྲ་མེད། དྲི་མེད། རོ་མེ། རེག་བྱ་མེད། ཆོས་མེད་དོ། །
groups.english: No appearance, no sound, no smell, no taste, no touch, no dharmas;
groups.phonetics: Zukmé Dramé Trimé Romé Rekcha mé Chömé to

groups.english: No eye dhatu up to no mind dhatu, no dhatu of dharmas, no mind consciousness dhatu;
groups.phonetics: Mik-ki kham-mé pa-né yikyi kham-mé Yikyi nampar shépé khamkyi partu-ang méto

groups.english: No ignorance, no end of ignorance up to no old age and death, no end of old age and death;
groups.phonetics: Marik pamé Marik pasé pamé pa-né gashi mé Gashi sépé partu-ang méto

groups.tibetan: དེ་བཞིན་དུ་སྡུག་བསྔལ་བ་དང་། ཀུན་འབྱུང་བ་དང་། འགོག་པ་དང་། ལམ་མེད། ཡེ་ཤེས་མེད། ཐོབ་པ་མེད། མ་ཐོབ་པའང་མེད་དོ། །
groups.english: No suffering, no origin of suffering, no cessation of suffering, no path, no wisdom, no attainment, and no nonattainment.
groups.phonetics: Tézhin tuduk ngalwa tang Künjung patang Gokpa tang Lam-mé Yéshé mé Thop-pa mé Mathop pa-ang méto

groups.english: Therefore, Sariputra, since the bodhisattvas have no attainment,
groups.phonetics: Shari pu Téta péna changchup sempa namla thop-pa mépé chir

groups.english: They abide by means of prajñaparamita. Since there is no obscuration of mind, there is no fear.
groups.phonetics: Shérap kyip'a röltu chinpa laten ching-né tésem ladrip pamé pétrak pamé té

groups.english: They transcend falsity and attain complete nirvana.
groups.phonetics: Chinchi loklé shintu déné nya-ngen lédé parthar chinto

groups.english: All the Buddhas of the three times, by means of prajñaparamita, fully awaken to unsurpassable, true, complete enlightenment.
groups.phonetics: Tüsum tunam parzhuk pésang gyatham chékyang shérap kyip'a röltu chinpa laten néla namé payang takpar dzokpé changchup tungön pardzok parsang gyéso

groups.english: Therefore, the great mantra of prajñaparamita, the mantra of great insight, the unsurpassed mantra, the unequaled mantra, the mantra that calms all suffering should be known as truth, since there is no deception. The prajñaparamita mantra is said in this way:
groups.phonetics: Téta péna shérap kyip'a röltu chinpé ngak Rikpa chenpö ngak La-na mépé ngak Minyam patang nyampar chépé ngak Dukngal thamché raptu zhiwar chépé ngak Midzün péna denpar shépar chaté Shérap kyip'a röltu chinpé ngakmé pa
Tadyata Katé katé para katé para samka tébodhi svaha

groups.english: Thus, Sariputra the badhisattva mahasattva should train in the prodound prajñaparamita.”
groups.phonetics: Shari puchang chupsem pasem pachen pöté tarshé rapkyi p'aröl tuchin pasap mola lap-par cha-o

groups.english: Then the Blessed One arose from that Samadhi and praised noble Avalokitesvara, the bodhisattva mahasattva, saying,
groups.phonetics: Téné chomden déting ngédzin télé zhengté changchup sempa sempa chenpo p'akpa chenrézi wangchuk lalek sozhé chawa chin-né

groups.english: “Good, good, O son of noble family; thus it is, O son of noble family, thus it is.
groups.phonetics: Lekso Lekso Rik-kyi pu Tété zhin-no Tété zhinté

groups.english: One should practice the profound prajñaparamita just as you have taught and all the tathagatas will rejoice.”
groups.phonetics: Chitar khyökyi tenpa zhintu shérap kyip'a röltu chinpa sapmo laché parcha té Tézhin shekpa namkyang jésu yirang ngo

groups.tibetan: བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱིས་དེ་སྐད་ཅེས་བཀའ་སྩལ་ནས། ཚེ་དང་ལྡན་པ་ཤཱ་ར་དྭ་ཏིའི་བུ་དང་། བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་སྤྱན་རས་གཟིགས་དབང་ཕྱུག་དང་། ཐམས་ཅད་དང་ལྡན་པའི་འཁོར་དེ་དག་དང་། ལྷ་དང་། མི་དང་། ལྷ་མ་ཡིན་དང་། དྲི་ཟར་བཅས་པའི་འཇིག་རྟེན་ཡི་རངས་ཏེ། བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱིས་གསུངས་པ་ལ་མངོན་པར་བསྟོད་དོ། །
groups.english: When the Blessed One had said this, venerable Sariputra and noble Avalokitesvara, the bodhisattva mahasattva, that whole assembly and the world with its gods, humans, asuras and gandharvas rejoiced and praised the words of the Blessed One.
groups.phonetics: Chomden dékyi téké chéka tsalné Tsétang denpa shara tati putang Changchup sempa chenrézi wangchuk tang Thamché tangden pékhor tétak tang Lhatang Mitang Lhama yintang Trisar chépé jikten yirang té Chomden dékyi sungpa la-ngön partö to
Ta Katé katé para katé para samka tébodhi svaha

groups.english: This completes the noble Sutra of the Heart of Transcendent Knowledge.

If you desire to practice this Heart Sutra, visualize in the sky before you the tathagata with the mudra that subjugates the maras. Among his retinue are Avolokitesvara and Sariputra, engaged in question and answer. They are surrounded by the sangha of the greater and lesser yanas. Chant this profound sutra, contemplating the meaning of sunyata, however many times up to seven. Then repeat the mantra of insight as many times as you can. After that, if you wish to exorcise the maras:
I prostrate to the Teacher, I prostrate to the Buddha.
groups.phonetics: Namo Lama lachak tsal-lo Sang-gyé lachak tsal-lo

groups.english: I prostrate to the Dharma. I prostrate to the Sangha.
groups.phonetics: Chöla chaktsal lo Gendün lachak tsal-lo

groups.english: I prostrate to the great mother Prajñaparamita.
groups.phonetics: Yumchen moshé rapkyi p'aröl tuchin pala chaktsal lo

groups.english: May the truth of my words be accomplished.
Previously, Indra Satakratu, lord of gods, contemplated and chanted the profound meaning of Prajñaparamita,
groups.phonetics: Chitar ngönlhé wangpo gyachin kyishé rapkyi p'aröl tuchin pétön sapmo yila samshing tsik-kha töntu chépa laten né

groups.english: And so exorcised the evil maras and all others who incite discord. Accordingly, may I contemplate and chant the profound meaning of the great mother Prajñaparamita,
groups.phonetics: Düdik chenla sokpa mithün péchok thamché chirdok paté zhintu daki kyangyum chenmo shérap kyip'a röltu chinpé tönsap moyin lasam shingtsik khatön tuché pala ten-né

groups.english: And so may I exorcise evil maras and all others who incite discord.
groups.phonetics: Düdik chenla sokpa mithün péchok thamché chirdok parkyur chik

groups.english: May they be annihilated. May the be pacified.
May they be utterly pacified.
After that:
Teaching the arising from interdependence,
No cessation, no birth,
No nihilism, no eternalism,
No coming, no going,
Free from many meanings, free from one meaning,
You, the teacher of peace, who removes complexity,
The perfect buddha, the best among men,
I prostrate to you.
One may conclude with dedication, aspiration and auspicious verses.
Seven Line Prayer
In Orgyen’s land upon its north-west rim,
On lotus, pistil-cup, and stem,
Wondrous, supreme mastery you found
And as the Lotus Born you are renowned.
A ring of many dakinis encircles you,
And in your footsteps practising we follow you.
To grant your blessing, come, we pray.
Guru Padma Siddhi Hung.
Prayer of the Three Kayas
In the pure realm of absolute space, free from conceptual constructions,
groups.phonetics: Émaho Trötral chökyi yingkyi zhingkham su

groups.english: Absolute reality, unborn and unceasing throughout past, present and future,
Dwells in the spontaneously perfect body of great bliss, free from action,
Endowed with sky-like impartial compassion:
We pray to the dharmakaya teacher,
We pray to the Lotus-Born of Oddiyana.
groups.phonetics: Orgyen padma jung-né la sölwa dep

groups.english: In the pure realm of spontaneously present great bliss,
Dwells the body of the Sugatas endowed with the five wisdoms –
Body, speech, mind, quality and action, –
Compassionately manifesting in various ways according to individual needs:
We pray to the samboghakaya teacher,
groups.phonetics: Lama longchö dzok-ku la sölwa dep

groups.english: We pray to the Lotus-Born of Oddiyana.
groups.phonetics: Orgyen padma jung-né la sölwa dep

groups.english: In the pure realm of our present world,
You appear through great compassion for beings’ sake,
Skilfully acting for their benefit according to need:
We pray to the nirmanakaya teacher
Of the past, present, and future,
We pray to the Lotus-Born of Oddiyana.
groups.phonetics: Orgyen padma jung-né la sölwa dep

groups.english: Samantabhadra, Vajrasattva, Garab Dorje, Shri Singha,
Padmakara and the twenty-five disciples – king and subjects;
So, Zur, Nup and Nyak, the one hundred treasure revealers, and the others –
To the teachers of the oral and treasure transmissions we pray.
Heart-son of Orgyen, the Second Buddha,
Sovereign of a throng of siddhas who have brought forth treasures,
You of wondrous life, protecting beings and the doctrine in degenerate times:
Chogyur Lingpa, to you we pray.
Beforehand Ridgzin Nuden Dorje Tsel,
And in the future, venerable Buddha Möpa Thayé,
And now you are indeed the Pandita of Drog, the regent of the Lotus-Born –
Jigdrel Yeshe Dorje, I pray to you!
Form of primal wisdom, two knowledges of all the buddhas,
You are Mañjushri, the play of wisdom and great love,
Lord of learned and accomplished masters, chariot of the Buddha’s teachings,
Péma Do-ngak Lingpa, to you we pray!
Lord of speech, embodiment of the path that pleases all the buddhas and their heirs,
The ground and source of true infinite renown,
Teacher, holder of the Buddha’s doctrine through your learning, study, and meditation,
Glorious Blazing Excellence of Virtue, to you we pray!
From the palace of the highest realms absolute space,
You show us directly that our own minds are dharmakaya.
Essence of all the buddhas of the three times,
Root Teacher, to you we pray.
Prayer in seven chapters to the great master of Oddiyana for the swift accomplishment of all desired aims
The first chapter: a prayer to the Guru’s three kayas combined with the Vajra Guru mantra:

groups.phonetics: Om ah hung vajra guru padma siddhi hung

groups.english: Om : The immortal vajra body of wisdom;
groups.phonetics: Om yik chimé yéshé dorjé ku

groups.english: Ah : The vajra speech, the all-pervading space of ultimate reality;
groups.phonetics: Ah ni künkhyap chöying dorjé sung

groups.english: Hung : The vajra mind, immutable great bliss –
groups.phonetics: Hung zhé déchen mingyur dorjé thuk

groups.english: Great master of Oddiyana, to you I pray.
Vajra : The primordially pure fortress of the space of ultimate reality, free of all conceptual constructs;
Guru : The five families of Thötrengtsel, heavy with great bliss;
Padma : Second Buddha, self-arisen, free from every defect;
Teacher never separated from the three kayas, to you I pray.
Siddhi : The four levels of vidyadharas of the common path are accomplished;
Outer, inner, secret obstacles are now no more;
Desired goals are gained according to our wish.
Hung : Grant that we be never parted from the sphere of primal wisdom.
groups.phonetics: Hung zhé yéshé thikler yermé dzö

groups.english: The second chapter: A prayer to the wondrous doctrine of the Buddha combined with the Vajra Guru mantra:
Om : The mind to mind transmission of the Conquerors: Samantabhadra;
groups.phonetics: Om ni gyalwa gong-gyü küntu zang

groups.english: Ah : The sign-transmission of vidyadharas, the net of magical illusion;
groups.phonetics: Ah zhé dagyü rikdzin gyutr'ül tra

groups.english: Hung : The charioteer of the hearing transmission, Lotus-born;
groups.phonetics: Hung zhé nyengyü shingta padma jung

groups.english: Guru endowed with glorious qualities of the three transmissions, to you I pray
Vajra : The path of the unsurpassed secret mantrayana, the tantras;
Guru : Yidams and dakinis – the peaceful and wrathrul dance;
Padma : Lotus garland of inconceivable beneficial activity;
All encompassing Lord of an infinity of mandalas, to you I pray,
You are the Lord of the boundless treasury of kahma and terma teachings.
Siddhi : The great and secret path of accomplishment of wisdom:
May the teachings increase and its holders prosper. May all discords cease.
Hung : May we attain the vajra mind of the all-pervading Lord.
groups.phonetics: Hung yik khyapda dorjé médrup sho

groups.english: The third chapter : the prayer of the South-Western sun combined with the Vajra Guru mantra:
Om : The profound luminosity, vast expanse of the youthful vase body;
groups.phonetics: Om ni tingsal zhön-nu pumpé ying

groups.english: Ah : The field of joy and great bliss, the sovereign of the dance;
groups.phonetics: Ah yik karwang déchen gawé zhing

groups.english: Hung : The self-display of awareness, the pure field of Lotus Light;
groups.phonetics: Hung zhé rang-nang khachö padma ö

groups.english: Lord of the Buddhafields of the three kayas, to you we pray.
Vajra : In the immeasurable palace of the ultimate expanse,
Guru : Lord of Orgyen, great teacher, training all according to their need,
Padma : Lotus-born endowed with the five certitudes,
I pray to you the teacher in your place and with your retinue.
Siddhi : if we fail to follow to the end the vajra path,
May we be instantly reborn in your place of joy,
And in accordance with your prophecy, may we gaze unhindered on your countenance.
Hung : May we be never parted from the primal wisdom of the Lotus-Born.
groups.phonetics: Hung yik péjung yéshé rochik sho

groups.english: The fourth chapter : a prayer of great bliss, the freedom from mental elaboration, combined with the Vajra Guru mantra:
Om : Primordial Buddha, Vajradhara;
groups.phonetics: Om ni tangpo sang-gyé küntu chang

groups.english: Ah : Five illusory families of the guru garlanded with skulls;
groups.phonetics: Ah zhé thötr'eng gyutr'ül rikchok nga

groups.english: Hung : The lake-born teacher of this saha world;
groups.phonetics: Hung yik mijé tönpa tsolé kyé

groups.english: O Guru of the six transmissions, to you we pray.
Vajra : The tantras of the phantasmagorical net, and the eight great sadhanas;
Guru : The vast wisdom held within the Guru’s single sphere;
Padma : Guru garlanded with skulls, vast treasure of accomplishment;
Second Buddha, at your feet we pray.
Siddhi : In the radiance of the single wisdom sphere,
By the power of joyful play of deity, mantra and primal wisdom,
The darkness of the delusion of dualistic clinging is cleansed all by itself.
Hung : May we never part from the vast expanse of primal wisdom.
groups.phonetics: Hung zhé yéshé longtu nyimé sho

groups.english: The fifth chapter : a prayer combining the great sindhu ocean with the Vajra Guru mantra:
Om : Amitabha, immortal lord;
Ah : Vajra of speech, holder of the lotus;
groups.phonetics: Ah ni sungki dorjé pékar chang

groups.english: Hung : Teacher of the Snowy Land and knower of the three times,
groups.phonetics: Hung zhé kangchen tönpa tüsum khyen

groups.english: We pray to you, embodiment of all the Buddhas’ primal wisdom.
Vajra : Immortal lake-born Lord of indestructible body,
Guru : Your life of great bliss is beyond imagining.
Padma : Beautiful like a lotus, twelve truly meaningful deeds
You wondrously performed. To you we pray.
Siddhi : That we might attain enlightenment, from you never parted,
We call to you and pray with powerful yearning:
Dispel all degeneration and trouble and grant us peace and happiness.
Hung : May we gain enlightenment in the great mystery of the syllable Hung.
groups.phonetics: Hung yik sangwa chenpor changchup sho

groups.english: The sixth chapter, a prayer combining the small sindhu ocean with the Vajra Guru mantra:
Om : Your sky-like vajra body fills the whole of space;
groups.phonetics: Om yik khakhyap namkha dorjé ku

groups.english: Ah : Your speech equipped with sixty melodies is all encompassing;
groups.phonetics: Ah ni künkhyap nampa thamché sung

groups.english: Hung : Your powerful mind of knowledge, love, and ability –
groups.phonetics: Hung zhé khyentsé nüpé tsalden thuk

groups.english: Never separate from these, O Vajra-master, to you we pray.
Vajra : Expanse of the wheel of inexhaustible ornaments,
Guru : Equal to all Buddhas in your deeds,
Padma : Lotus-born, perfet in all excellence, free from every fault.
We pray to you, unequaled in great kindness.
Siddhi : To your deeds and cultivation of your bodhichitta
May we have the fortune to be joined inseparably.
The actions for those difficult to tame, as long as space exists,
Hung : We pray that you will cause them to arise at all times, everywhere, spontaneously.
groups.phonetics: Hung yik tak-khyap lhündrup dzétu söl

groups.english: The seventh chapter : a prayer for spontaneous accomplishment of one’s wishes, combined with the Vajra Guru mantra:
Om : A great wellspring of ten millionfold good fortune
groups.phonetics: Om yik trashi chéwé jung-né ché

groups.english: Ah : is the immortal Amitabha appearing as Vidyadhara.
groups.phonetics: Ah zhé nangtha chimé rikdzin tsül

groups.english: Hung : King of great bliss, subduer of phenomenal existence,
groups.phonetics: Hung ki nangsi silnön déchen gyal

groups.english: Lord of Orgyen, wish-fulfilling jewel, to you we pray.
Vajra : Though you are never parted from the state of ultimate wisdom,
Guru : The manifestations of your form achieve the aims and aspirations of beings.
Padma : We call to mind the thirteen manifestations of the Lotus King
And pray that spontaneously you will fulfil our aims and aspirations.
Siddhi : Until we gain immutable great bliss,
Indivisible from enlightenment, may all hindrances be subdued
And our desires be effortlessly gained.
Hung : We beg you, grant that all our aims and aspirations be achieved.
groups.phonetics: Hung zhé külzhin samtön kündrup dzö

groups.english: The eighth chapter, a prayer to remove obstacles combined with the Vajra Guru mantra:
Om : Dharmakaya, Amitabha, Amitayus;
Ah : Sambhogakaya, guide of beings, Avalokita;
Hung : Glorious subduer of phenomenal existence, Lotus-Born –
groups.phonetics: Hung ki nangsi silnön padma jung

groups.english: Teacher in the form of the three kayas, we pray to you.
Vajra : The true meaning of the central channel in the form of joy,
Guru : The twelve Vidyadharas are your manifestations,
Padma : You are the entire assembly of the Mayajala mandala.
With unshakeable and yearning faith we pray to you.
Siddhi : That we may, for the present, perform the four activities and gain the eight accomplishments,
And finally attain the level of Mahamudra.
May obstacles, outer, inner, and secret all be pacified.
Hung : May all become of one taste in the sphere of primal wisdom.
groups.phonetics: Hung yik yéshé thikler rochik sho
Om ah hung vajra guru padma siddhi hung

groups.english: On the bank of the sweetly flowing stream of Malung, in an alpine pasture in the medicinal valley at the foot of mountain Lhari Manyak, and in order to invoke the blessing of the mind transmission of the self-arisen Padma from Oddiyana, this prayer; which harmoniously combines the indestructible vidya mantra of the self-arisen secret with the wisdom meaning of his vajra words, was set down in writing by a disciple pleasing to the Lake-born Guru, Pema Ösel Dongak Lingpa, Jigme Khyentse Özer. May the blessing of the wisdom mind-to-mind transmission dissolve into us as a nectar for our minds.
Lineage prayer
Begin by reciting “The Garland of Utpalas”, the lineage prayer of the mind treasure “The profound essence of Tara”.
To the dharmakaya, Prajñaparamita, Bhagavati Kuntuzangmo,
To the samboghakaya, Vajra Varahi,
And to its display, the nirmanakaya, the noble Mother Tara
I pray, bestow the supreme and common accomplishments.
To Padmakara, the second Buddha,
To the queen of the hundred thousand dakinis, holder of the treasure of the secret mantras,
And to the bodhisattva Lhase Rolpa Tsel
I pray, bestow the supreme and common accomplishments.
To Chogyur Dechen Lingpa who reveals the profound treasures,
To Dorje Ziji, holder of the seven transmissions,
And to Pema Garwang who elucidates the doctrine of the Buddha
I pray, bestow the supreme and common accomplishments.
To those, as well, who hold the treasury of the profound and extensive teachings that mature and liberate,
The root and lineage teachers, the Exalted Mother, goddess swift in action,
And the infinite Three Roots and protectors of the adamantine teachings
I pray, bestow the surpreme and common accomplishments.
Watering the field of my mind with the thought of renunciation,
Tending the shoot with pure superior motivation
And bearing the fruit of great wisdom,
May I spontaneously accomplish the two goals.
This was written by Mañjugosha. May virtue and excellence increase!
groups.phonetics: Zhépa-ang manjugoshé tripa gélek p'el Gé-o

groups.english: Tara Sadhana
“The Essence of the Two Accumulations”
groups.phonetics: Gongter drölma-o saptik lé Mandala choka tsoknyi nyingpo zhécha pazhuk so

groups.english: The mandala ritual from the Mind Treasure,
“The Profound Essence of Tara”
Homage to Arya Tara!
Bowing down to Tara,
The mother of all the guides of the three times and their children,
Who embodies their wondrous compassionate activities,
I shall explain the practice in accordance with Kriya and Upa Tantras.

Since these Zaptik teachings are the quintessence of the profound teachings, there is no need for much detail. Nevertheless, here are two practices: one an expanded, slightly detailed practice, and the other a condensed practice for daily use.

1. Expanded practice – In front of any available support of the Three Jewels, such as an image – a picture or statue – of Noble Tara, on a clean altar arrange the two water offerings and the five general offerings, a white round torma, purification water, an offering mandala and so on. If you can, wash and maintain cleanliness in all activities. If not, at least abstain from meat and wine.
groups.phonetics: Tangpo ni Jétsün drölmé kunyen tribur sok-kön chok-ki tenkang dzomdün tutek putsang marchu nyinyer chö Kardum Sangchu Chöpé mandala Thorné sokdu ché Drupna tr'ütang tsangdré künchö tangden pacha zhing Michok nasha changma rölwé ngatrö chata pusi léngé jungtang

groups.english: In the morning, with an attitude of renunciation from samsara and of bodhichitta, recite the refuge and bodhichitta, considering that:
In the sky before me is Noble Tara, present in person.
groups.phonetics: Dünkyi namkhar jétsün ma-ngön sumtu zhukpar möla

groups.english: In Tara who embodies all the Precious Ones
I and all beings go for refuge.
Having generated bodhichitta in aspiration
I shall put it into action on the profound path.
Accumation of merit
To Arya Tara, and to all the buddhas
And bodhisattvas dwelling in the
Ten directions and the three times,
I submit obeisance with clear faith.
I pray to all assemblies of the Exalted Mother
To accept these offerings of flowers, incense, lamps, scented water,
Delicacies, music and so forth –
Material offerings and those imagined by the mind.
I confess all the evil deeds
I have committed with my mind overpowered by defilements
From beginningless time until now,
The ten negatice active actions and the five crimes with immediate retribution.
I rejoice at all the merit accumulated
In the past, present and future through the virtuous actions
Of the bodhisattvas, solitary realizers,
Listeners, ordinary beings and so forth.
I pray to you to turn the Wheel of Dharma
Of the greater, lesser and common vehicles
According to beings’ particular needs
And their different capacities.
Until samsara is emptied
Do not pass into nirvana,
But with compassion watch over all beings
Drowning in the ocean of suffering.
May all the merit I have accumulated
Be the cause for attaining enlightenment,
And may I thus, without delay,
Become a glorious guide for beings.
Blessing of the offerings

groups.phonetics: Om vajra amrita kundali hana hana hung phet
Om sobhawa shuddo sarwa dharma sobhawa shuddo hang

groups.english: This place is the Buddhafield of the Lotus Array
An immeasurable display of forms and ornaments;
Here the offerings become inconceivable celestial riches
Manifested through concentration.

groups.phonetics: Om vajra argham Padyam Pushpé Dhupé Aloké Gandhé Naiwindyé Shapta ࿗ 9 ࿗hung

groups.english: Next, begin with the general obeisance and offering to the Precious Ones:
In the sky before me I invite all the teachers, buddhas and bodhisattvas of the four times and ten directions with Vajra Samadza.
groups.phonetics: Chokchu tüzhi lama gyalwa sétang chépa thamché dünkyi namkhar vajra sama dza

groups.english: Protectors of all beings without exception,
Deities who vanquish the innumerable maras and their armies,
You who know everything as it is without exception,
Lords and your retinues, I pray, came to this place.
groups.phonetics: Chomden khorché nédir sheksu söl Padma kamala yé tam

groups.english: Recite the seven branches:
To all the tathagatas, lions of men,
As many as there are in the universe of the ten directions
And the three times – to all of them without exception
I pay homage with clear devotion of body, speech and mind.
Through the power of this Prayer of Good Action,
Bowing down to all the conquerors visualized as truly present
With bodies numerous as the atomes of the universe,
I make full obeisance to all the buddhas.
Upon a single atom reside as many buddhas
As there are atoms in the universe, surrounded by bodhisattvas;
And thus do I imagine the whole of the expanse of reality
Filled with all those conquerors.
Telling the qualities of all the conquerors
With all the sounds of ocean-like melodies,
All oceans of inexhaustible praise,
To all the sugatas I sing praises.
To all the conquerors I make offerings
Of the loveliest flowers, of beautiful garlands,
Cymbals, scented water, the best of parasols,
The brightest butter lamps and the finest incense;
Fine raiment and the most fragrant scents,
And incense powders piled as high as Mount Meru,
Meticulously prepared and arranged as perfectly as possible,
I offer to all the conquerors.
All such offerings, unsurpassed and vast,
By the force of my devotion to all the conquerors
And of my confidence in good action,
I offer with obeisance to all the conquerors.
Whatever faults I have committed
By body, speech or by mind
Because of craving, hatred and ignorance,
I acknowledge and leave behind each one of them.
I rejoice at all the merits in the ten directions
Of all the buddhas, and of all bodhisattvas,
Solitary realizers, listeners – training and beyond training –
And of all beings.
I exhort all the protectors, the lights of the universe of the ten directions,
Who have attained buddhahood, free from attachment,
Though the successive stages of awakening,
To turn the wheel of the unsurpassable Dharma.
Folding my hands together, I pray to those
Who would demonstrate their parinirvana
To remain for the benefit and happiness of all beings
For kalpas as many as the atoms in the universe.
What little merit I have accumulated by
Obeisance, offering, purification,
Rejoicing, exhortation and prayer –
All of it I dedicate to enlightenment.
Mandala offering
All the bodies, possessions and accumulation of virtue
groups.phonetics: Om ah hung Datang thayé semchen kyi

groups.english: Of myself and infinite beings,
The four continents, Mount Meru, the sun and moon
And the inconceivable riches of gods and men –
Great clouds of offerings
Emanated continuously as did Samantabhadra,
I offer constantly, with devotion,
To the infinite precious Three Jewels and Three Roots,
Dharma protectors and gods of wealth.
May the great accumulation of merit be fully completed,
May the visions of wisdom expand.

groups.phonetics: Om guru déwa dakini sarwa ratna mandala puja méha ah hung Zhémandala p'ül

groups.english: Prayer for the fulfilment of one’s wishes
Buddha, Dharma and Sangha,
Lamas, yidams and dakinis,
Dharma protectors, wealth gods and keepers of treasure –
From the essential nature of the single wisdom,
You are the unimpeded expression, shown forth in different ways;
Wondrous in its activities is your compassion!
Protectors and refuges of all beings,
To you whose nature is omniscience and love
I submit obeisance, from my heart I take refuge.
Offering my body and possessions, I pray:
With constant compassion
Protect us infinite beings.
Remove sickness and negative forces,
Extend our lifespan and merit
And bless us that every one of our wishes
Be fulfilled in accordance with the Dharma.
groups.phonetics: Chözhin drup-par chinkyi lop Zhédö tönsöl

groups.english: Next, the particular triple offering to Tara and recitation of the tantra of her praise.
Invitation
Remembered in an instant, complete and perfect,
I visualize myself as Noble Tara:
In her heart a moon, and on it, the green letter Tam,
From which emanate infinite rays of light,
Inviting in the sky before me
The twenty-one manifestations of Tara
With spreading clouds of infinite Precious Ones.
From the expanse of dharmakaya, luminous and free from birth,
Arise as the unobstructed wisdom body of Tara,
The net of phantasmagorical display, benefeting according to need.
Come, Arya Tara, come!
For as long as my offering may last,
Through compassion for us beings,
With your miraculous power,
Bhagavati, I request you to remain.
(1) General offering
Material riches and those imagined by the mind,
Samantabhadra clouds of offerings
Spreading and filling the expanse of reality
I offer to Arya Tara and her retinue.

groups.phonetics: Om arya taré sapariwara vajra argham Padyam Pushpé Dhupé Aloké Gandhé Naiwindyé Shapta pratitsa svaha

groups.english: (2) The particular  offering of the mandala
All the glory and riches of the three realms, the universe and beings,
My body, possessions and accumulation of virtue
I offer to you whose nature is compassion.
Accept them and bestow your blessings.

groups.phonetics: Om sarwa tathagata ratna mandala puja ho

groups.english: After this, recite twice the Homage to the Twenty-One Taras, the King of Praises tantra:
Holy Tara, noble one, to you I bow down.
groups.phonetics: Om jé tsünma p'akma drölma lachak tsal-lo

groups.english: I bow to you O Tara, swift and brave;
With Tuttara you banish all fears;
You free with Ture, giving all things;
I bow to you by crying Soha!
I bow to you, brave lady, swift to free,
Whose eyes look down with lightning speed,
Who sprang forth from a lotus in flower:
The face of him who guards the three worlds.
I bow to you whose face is clear and bright,
And shining like a hundred autumn full moons,
That gleams whith radiance of a thousand stars
And, all-revealing, blazes with light.
I bow to you of green and golden hue,
A lotus, water-born, adorning your hand.
Giving, joyous effort, discipline, peace,
Patience, concentration: these are your deeds.
I bow to you, the buddhas’ crown jewel,
Who tastes of victory without bounds.
For bodhisattvas, those who abtain
All transcendent virtues, you’re their mainstay.
I bow to you who fill with sounds of Tuttara and Hung
All directions, space, the realms of desire,
Who press the seven regions under your feet,
Reducing all things under your sway.
I bow to you whom Indra, Brahma,
Agni, Pavana, the mighty, revere.
Elves and wraiths and orcs, the devilish hosts
Now come before you crying their praise.
I bow to you. with Tret and Phet you bring low
The spells and magic of the black arts –
With right leg folded, left leg outstretched –
You crush them, burning them in fierce fire.
I bow to you, most dreadful and swift.
The warriors of Mara you completely destroy –
Your lotus face all furrowed with wrath,
Without exception slaying all foes.
I bow to you, the mudra of the Three Jewels
Your fingers make, adorning your heart.
And from your hand adorned with a wheel,
Effulgent light shines forth on all sides.
I bow to you who spreads sublime joy
With rays of light that garland your crown.
With Tuttara you laugh with great mirth
And bring the world and demons under your sway.
I bow to you who summon at will
All hosts of those protecting the earth.
With Hung and with the frown of your face,
From every dearth and want you set free,
I bow to you – the crescent moon on your crown
And all your jewels, are blazing with light.
From Amitabha, throned on your hair,
You send forth brilliant light at all times.
I bow to you encircled with fire
That burns and flames as at the world’s end.
With left leg folded, right leg outstretched,
You turn the wheel of joy and crush the hordes of our foes.
I bow to you who with the palms of your hands
Press down the earth and pound it with your feet.
With wrinkled fury and the syllable hung!
The seven netherworlds you quell and subdue.
I bow to you, O virtuous, blissful mother of peace,
Enjoying in yourself the peace beyond pain,
Your mantra graced with Om and Soha
Utterly destroys our great sins.
I bow to you who turn the wheel that bestows
Great joy to those whose foes you subdue;
Whom with the mantra of the ten sounds
And with the vidya-mantra of the Hung you set free.
I bow to you, who stamp with swift feet,
Who are of Hung the manifest form.
Meru, Mandara, the Vindya peaks –
The three worlds all – you worry and shake.
I bow to you who hold in your hand
The hare-marked moon shaped like a heavenly lake.
By crying Phet, and twice-said Tara,
You banish every poison, leaving no trace.
I bow to you: the kings of the gods,
The kinnaras and gods attend you.
And with your armour: splendour and joy,
You drive away all strife and bad dreams.
I bow to you whose shining bright eyes
Are brilliant like the sun and full moon.
With Tuttara and twice-said Hara,
You drive out deadly murrain and plague.
I bow to you. with threefold suchness,
You perfectly possess the power to give peace.
Demons, orcs, the devilish hosts
Are swiftly crushed, O lady unsurpassed!
With mula-mantra and these praises,
One and twenty times to you I bow down.
Make the general offering starting with:
Om Ngöjor yilé… and offer the mandala as before.
Then:
The right hand turns from the mudra of sublime giving
To the mudra of granting protection:
I and all my protégés are brought under it
And are liberated from all kinds of fear.
Concentrating on this, recite the Homage to the Twenty-One Taras three times.
Again make the general offering starting with:
Om Ngöljor yilé…
and offer the mandala as before.
Then:
From her body descends a stream of nectar,
Entering me and my protégés through our crowns
And completely filling our bodies:
We receive all blessings without exception.
Concentrating on this, recite the Homage to the Twenty-One Tara seven times, then recite the benefits.
To those who thus have perfect reverence,
Wisely praising thus the goddess,
Think of her at dusk and morning,
When they rise, she grants great courage,
All their evil deeds consuming
And their evil births destroying.
Seventy million Buddhas bless them,
Giving them their swift empowerment.
In this life they come to greatness,
Buddhahood at lengh attaining.
Venoms deadly, drunk or eaten
That from plant or beast are taken,
Thinking of her, they dispel them.
And indeed for others also,
They will rout the mass of sorrows:
Demons, plagues and poisons suffered!
Twice or thrice or seven times chanting,
Those who want a child will get one,
Those who wish for wealth will find it:
Every boon will thus be granted.
They will have no further hindrance.
Every obstacle will be destroyed!
Cleanse the torma with:

groups.phonetics: Om vajra amrita kundali hana hana hung phet

groups.english: And purify it with:

groups.phonetics: Om sobhawa düsarwa dharma sapwa shuddo hang

groups.english: From the state of emptiness appears the syllable Om,
Which transforms into a vast and precious sublime container
In which, from the three syllables, the torma appears,
Transforming into the undefiled elixir of wisdom.
(three times)
Offer the torma to the principal deities by saying:

groups.phonetics: Om arya taré sapariwara idam balingta kha kha khahi khahi

groups.english: (three times)
And to all the other guests by saying:

groups.phonetics: Om akaro mukham sarwa dharma nam adi anütpena tota om ah hung phet svaha

groups.english: (three times)
With your great wisdom
Consider this torma, offered and given:
Accept it in the state of great bliss
And bestow all accomplishments without exception.
In this way, pray for the fulfilment of your wishes. Then make the offerings:
Praise:
Born in the family of Amitabha
groups.phonetics: Om arya taré sapariwara vajra argham sok-kyi chö

groups.english: Sprung from the face of the Mighty Lord of the World (Avalokiteshvara),
Sovereign of all the buddhas’ activities,
Noble Tara, I bow down in praise.
To all you most worthy of praise
I bow down with bodies numerous as the atoms in the universe,
Perpetually submitting obeisance,
Praising you with the utmost devotion.
Then fold your hands and pray:
O Noble Tara and your retinue,
Think of me with love and compassion beyond concepts.
Grant the blessing that there be no obstruction
To the fulfilment of my prayers.
Spread and extend the Buddha’s teachings,
Keep harmony among the holders of the doctrine, ensure their long lives;
Dispel all obstacles that might endanger them,
And extend the activities of study and practice.
Remove sickness, famine and war
And increase virtue, glory and prosperity.
Extend the dominion of those kings who protect the Dharma,
Bring happiness to all lands.
From the sixteen dangers, untimely death,
Nightmares and bad omens,
The sufferings of the lower realms of samsara
And all such fears, temporay and ultimate, give your protection.
May our lifespan, merit, power, experience and realisation increase,
May thoughts of non-virtue never arise,
May the two types of bodhichitta be effortlessly born –
Bring the accomplishment of all wishes that accord with the Dharma.
From now until I reach the essence of enlightenment
Watch over me with the eye of compassion,
Never parting from me, like a mother with her only child.
I pray, make me inseparable from you.
As a result of invoking Tara’s blessings with this special prayer for the fulfilment of your wishes,
groups.phonetics: Zhédö pétön lasöl pakhyé partu tapching thuktam külwé

groups.english: The deity before me melts into light and dissolves into me:
Thus blessed, in the state of inseparability
I become Noble Tara,
Appearing yet insubstantial.
With this, concentrate on the clear visualisation and “pride” of yourself as Tara and recite the ten-syllable mantra as mush as you can:
At the end to confess your faults, recite the hundred-syllable mantra.
Then recite:
Whatever I did not use, whatever I did not complete,
Whatever I was unable to do –
Whatever mistakes I have made in this practice –
All these, please forgive.
groups.phonetics: Tékün khyökyi zödzé rik Chéjö la-nong pashak

groups.english: Here, inseparable from this image,
For the duration of samsara may you remain.
Bestow power, long life and freedom from sickness,
And all that is sublime and excellent.
If you don’t have a support for the practice, say the prayer starting with Om Khékyi sémchen … and Vajra Mu, by which the other guests depart.
The deity and my mind are inseparable:
I rest in the natural stillness of the expanse of reality.
Thus maintain the view of the natural state.
Dedication and aspiration
By this merit may I quickly accomplish
The nature of Noble Tara;
Omitting not a single being,
May I establish them all in her level.
groups.phonetics: Diyi sala göpar sho Chéngo möncha

groups.english: Like the wishfulfilling jewel and the excellent vase,
Unhindered, you grant all wishes.
May we have the good fortune that Tara, the buddhas and bodhisattvas
Protect us with compassion and never separate from us.
With this prayer for auspiciousness, throw florwers in the air.

groups.tibetan: གཉིས་པ་རྒྱུན་ཁྱེར་བྱ་བའི་ཚེ། འཕགས་མའི་རྟེན་འཛོམས་ན་ལེགས༑ ༑མ་འཛོམས་ན་ཡིད་ཀྱིས་བསྒོམ་པས་འཐུས། མནྜལ་དང་མཆོད་པ་བཤམས་ལ་གོང་དུ་སྨོས་པའི། མདུན་གྱི་ནམ་མཁར་སོགས་ནས་སྐྱབས་སེམས་དང་མཆོད་པ་བྱིན་རླབས་བར་བཏང་། དཀོན་མཆོག་སྤྱི་མཆོད་མི་དགོས་པས། རང་ཉིད་སྐད་ཅིག་དྲན་རྫོགས་སུ༔ རྗེ་བཙུན་འཕགས་མའི་སྐུར་གསལ་བའི༔ སོགས་ནས། མཆོད་པ་མནྜལ་བསྟོད་པ་ལན་གསུམ་བསྐྱར་བའི་ཕྱི་མ་ཕྱག་འཚལ་ཉེར་ གཅིག་ཚར་བདུན་ཕན་ཡོན་དང་བཅས་པའི་མཐར། སྤྲོ་ན། རྗེ་བཙུན་འཕགས་མ་འཁོར་དང་བཅས༔ སོགས་འདོད་གསོལ་གྲུབ་ན་བྱ། མ་བྱས་ཀྱང་ཆོག །མདུན་བསྐྱེད་འོད་ཞུ་སོགས་ནས་བཟླས་པ། ནོངས་བཤགས་བར་སྔར་ལྟར་ལ། གཤེགས་གསོལ་མི་དགོས། ལྷ་དང་རང་སེམས་སོགས་དང་། དགེ་བསྔོ་ཤིས་བརྗོད་བཅས་ཀྱིས་འགྲུབ་བོ། །
groups.english: 2. Condensed practice - For the daily practice, it is good to have an image of Tara, but if you do not have one, you may visualize Tara. arrange the mandala and offerings as mentioned above. Recite the refuge, bodhichitta, and blessing the offerings, beginning with “Dünkyi namkhar” and so on. It is not necessary to do the general offering to the Precious Ones. Beginning with “Rang nyi kéchik trendzok su  Jétsün pamé kursel wé” and so on, repeat the offering, mandala offering and praise three times, after which recite the Homage to the Twenty-One Taras, seven times together with its benefits. At the end, if you like, you may pray for the fulfilment of your wishes with “Jétsün pama kortang ché” and so on. It is, however, acceptable to omit this. Continue with “Dünkyé öshu” and so on, after which recite the mantra. Confess mistakes as before. There is no need to request the other guests to depart. Conclude with “Lhatang rangsem” and so on, and the dedication and prayer for auspiciousness.
groups.phonetics: Nyipa gyünkhyer chawé tsé P'akmé tendzom nalek Madzom nayi kyigom péthü Natang chöpa shamla kongtu möpé Dünkyi namkhar sokné kyapsem tangchö pachin lapwar tang Könchok chichö migö pé Rang-nyi kéchik trendzok su Jétsün p'akmé kursal wé Sokné Chöpa natö palen sumkyar péchi machak tsalnyer Chiktsar dünp'en yöntang chépé thar Tro-na Jétsün p'akma khortang ché Sokdö söltrup nacha Maché kyangchok Dünkyé özhu sokné dépa Nongshak parngar tarla Sheksöl migö Lhatang rangsem soktang Géngo shijö chékyi drupwo

groups.english: With this virtuous practice, may the waves of benefit and happiness
Billow on the ocean of beings’ merit,
And may the lotus river of the holders of the Buddha’s teachings
Bring joy throughout time and space.
This was composed by Patrul. Sarva Mangalam.
Dedication Prayers Related to Sublime Tara
Compassionate Jetsun Bhagavati,
May I and all the infinite beings purify
The two obscurations and quickly complete the two accumulations,
And then attain perfect Buddhahood,
And in all the lifetimes in which we don’t attain it,
May we obtain the superior happiness of the gods and humans.
Then, when we attain omniscience,
May obsctacles, spirits and harmful beings, famine, disease, and so on,
And the various events that cause untimely death,
Bad dreams and bad omens, and
The eight kinds of fears and such dangers
Quickly be pacified and eliminated.
May all the auspicious, fortunate, and excellent accumulations of
This world and those beyond this world
Increase and expand, and may all our aims,
Without exception, be spontaneously and effortlessly accomplished.
May efforts to practice and the supreme Dharma spread,
And continuously doing your practice, may we see your sublime face;
May we realize the meaning of emptiness, and may the precious Bodhicitta
Increase and spread like the waxing moon.
By Jetsun Dragyal.
May I be born within a beautiful lotus
In that excellent and joyous realm of the victorious one,
And from the victorious one Amitabha directly
May I receive a prophecy.
From prayer of good actions.
Deity whom we have practiced in our precious lives,
Activity of all buddhas past, present and to come,
You who are blue-green, one-faced, two-handed, brave and swift to pacify,
Mother, holder of the utpala: may everything be auspicious!
Taken from the words of Pakpa Rinpoche.
By the power of praising and praying to you,
Wherever we live and all around,
May sickness, negative forces, poverty, and strife be eliminated,
And may the Dharma and good fortune increase.
Attributed to the Dharma king Trisong Detsen.
Mother of the buddhas, Tara, in every respect – your bodily form,
You circle of disciples, length of life, buddhafield,
And your sublime marks of excellence –
May I and others become just like you.
Taken from the sutras.
Riwo Sangchö Sadhana
The Purificatory Incense Offering on top of the Mountain

For the practice of the Purificatory Incense Offering, here is a pith instruction of Lhatsün Namkha Jikme’s “Rigdzin Sokdrup”. In a clean vessel or hearth, light a good fire and in it burn fragrant woods, aromatic, medicinal plants, white and sweet substances, all kinds of incense, flour, butter, and so on – whatever is available. Sprinkle them with pure water.
Begin by taking refuge three times:
Quintessence of all the refuges of samsara and nirvana, equal to space itself,
Powerful, wrathful vidyadhara Pema Thötrengstel.
Within your body the whole phenomena is the perfect mandala of the victorious ones.
In you I take refuge that I may free all beings from samsara.
Recite three times the prayer of bodhichitta:
So that in the ground, the sphere of the supremely secret luminous wisdom,
All beings purify the three obscurations and achieve the sphere of enlightened body,
Speech and mind through the four visions of spontaneous presence,
Thus gaining freedom in the ever-youthful vase-base, I generate bodhichitta.
Seven Branch Offering
Paying homage in the basic state of awareness, unfabricated, forever present,
I make the offering of the infinite, fathomless radiant clarity.
In the expanse of the sameness of samsara and nirvana I make confession.
In the great exhaustion of phenomena, beyond intellect, I rejoice.
Turn the wheel of the spontaneously present Great Perfection,
Stir up the depths of samsara, I pray.
Free from the concepts of the three spheres, I make the ultimate dedication.
Self-visualisation
From the primordially pure absolute space of dharmakaya, I manifest unobstructedly
As the youthful Pema Thötrengtsel.  He is beautiful and of white and rosy hue.
Blazing with the splendour of the major and minor marks, holding vajra and skullcup,
He is majestic with all the attributes and ornaments.
The meditational deity and wisdom deity are inseparable.
Embodying all the victorious ones, he is the supreme glory of all samsara and nirvana.

groups.phonetics: Om ah hung vajra guru padma siddhi hung

groups.english: Recite one hundred times.
Then cleanse and purify the smoke offering materials with :
Ram Yam Kham   From the state of emptiness the smoke offering ingredients turn into untainted wisdom-elixir streaming out to fill the sky with billowing oceans of clouds of sensual delights.
groups.phonetics: Tongpé nganglé sangdzé sakpa mépé yéshé kyidü tsidö yöngyamtsö trinp'ung khakhyap tutr'o parkyur

groups.english: Bless them, saying the three syllables and the Sky-Treasure mantra three times:
(three times)

groups.phonetics: Nama Sarwa tatha kato bayo bishu mukébé sarwa tamgü tésaparana imam gagana kham saha

groups.english: (three times)
In a vast, pure vessel made of all kinds of jewels
All the desirable things of this world – the samaya substances –
Blessed with the three syllables, are transmuted into wisdom-nectar:
Phenomenal existence, all the things one could desire, is offered to these guests –
To the lamas, yidams, dakinis and protectors,
To all the mandalas of the buddhas of the ten directions,
To the local deities of this world, to the beings of the six realms, and to those to whom any karmic debts are owed;
In particular to those who would rob me of my life and vital energy,
To the forces that cause illness, obstables;
To those who send bad signs in dreams and other evil omens,
To the eight kinds of vicious beings, masters of magical display;
To all to whom I am indebted for food, shelter and possessions;
To the spirits who bring obscuration and insanity; to the ghosts of men and women;
To dri demons, teurang spirits, and deadly phantoms, spirits that haunt the habitations of the living.
Being thus consumed in these red flames, my karmic debts are all removed.
This rain of all that gratifies the wishes of beings, each and every one,
I distribute for as long as space endures,
As a never-ceasing abundance of delight.
May this offering made with fire purify
All my negative deeds and obscurations accumulated throughout the three times,
As well as the wrongful use of the possessions of the Three Jewels, of offerings made with faith, and of donations for the dead.
May every particle of these blazing tongues of fire, which fill the phenomenal world,
Become an inexhaustible cloud of gifts offered in the manner of Samantabhadra.
May they pervade the pure lands of the buddhas.
May these flames, offerings-rays of the five wisdom-lights,
Penetrate the six realms of existence down to the very Hell of Torment Unsurpassed.
May they liberate the three worlds in the rainbow body;
May all beings attain buddhahood in the heart of enlightenment.
Recite these three syllables as much as possible – a hundred times, a thousand times or more.
In the pure palace of the three kayas,
The dharmakaya, sambhogakaya and nirmanakaya, and the phenomenal world piled up in one great heap
Melt into nectar flooding the whole of space with rainbow light.
This pure untainted ambrosial essence of samsara and nirvana
I share with all those who until now from time without beginning
Have dwelt as guest within phenomenal existence.
May we perfect the qualities of the levels, path and fruit,
And dispelling every obstacle to our view, meditation and action,
May we seize the changeless state of the ever-youthful vase-body
In the expanse of sublime Samantabhadra’s mind.
When the great ocean of samsara is emptied,
May we attain enlightenment in the buddhafield unexcelled, the Lotus Net.
The burnt offerings, the aggregates and elements, blaze in dazzling majestic beauty;
The burnt offerings, the white and red essences, blaze as emptiness and bliss;
The burnt offerings, emptiness and compassion, fill the expanse of ultimate reality.
In the ground of the five vajra lights – the phenomenal world, samsara and nirvana –
I present the burnt offering of spontaneously accomplished buddhahood.
May all my pas karmic debts be purified.
I confess my present debts that they do not linger in my mind.
May I not be obscured by other debts in the future.
I confess all deterioration, whether conscious or unconscious,
Of the vows of individual liberation, the precepts of the bodhisattvas
And the secret mantra samayas of the vidyadharas.
May illness, negatice forces, obscurations and impurities be purified.
May there be relief in times of epidemics, famine and war.
Away with foreign invaders!
Away with obstacles to Dharma practice! May our teachers not depart!
Away with evil portents of misfortune in Tibet!
Away with planetary forces, nagas and gyalpo spirits, who snatch away our vital breath!
Away with the eightfold and the sixteenfold great dangers!
Away with misfortune for myself and those around me!
Away with the strength, power and skill of the gongpa and tamsi demons!
Samaya.

If you are accumulating a number of recitation of this practice, return to “Dhrum Rinchen natsok…” and so on. Then recite the three syllables many times, and continue with “Ku sum takpa…” and so on. Do this as many times as is appropriate.
Daily incense offering practice that accomplishes all activities
Taken from the Heart-Essence of Lama Phurba

groups.phonetics: Ram yam kham Om ah hung

groups.english: Three Jewels, Three Roots, different classes of protectors of the teachings,
And in particular, assembly of the deities of the mandala of Guru Vajrakilaya,
Accept this offering of samaya substance – this amrita  - like incense!
Totally protect us, the yogins, as well as the master together with his retinue,
Day ans night without any negligence or indolence,
Spread the teachings of the victorious ones in general and the teachings of the Vajrayana in particular,
And increase the activity of all the holders of the teachings.
Spontaneously accomplish the four activities!
Samaya. This short incense offering was written by Longchen Yeshe Dorje.
Incense offering of spontaneous activity
From “The Heart-Essence of the Most Profound Immortality”
groups.phonetics: Namo padma kara yé Lungté sangchö gyitro na Zangshing sangdzé mersek ching Tingdzin ngakgyé jangpel thar

groups.english: To make this incense offering to raise windhorse, burn good quality wood and the sang ingredients in a fire. Through the power of concentration and mantra, purify the offering and multiply it to the furthest reaches of space. Then recite the following:
Arisen from Samantabhadra’s aspirations
Is this offering cloud of cleansing incense;
To those who appear through the creative power of primordially pure awareness –
To the Three Jewels, the Three Roots, wealth deities and retinues,
And to the Dharma-protectors with eyes of wisdom, I offer this cleansing incense.
To those who show that phenomena, through the power of dependent arising,
Appears as good and bad, positive and negative,
To the Tiger, Lion, Garuda and Dragon of the four directions
And the deities of the fluctuation of the five elements, I offer cleansing incense;
And to the deities of the trigrams, of the méwa, of the years, month and days,
Of the planets and stars, to the ground-owners, and to the deities of date and time,
That all conditioning concepts grasping at virtue and non-virtue
In the vast sameness of purity may be cleansed, I offer incense;
That disorder, degeneration, decline, dullness and dimness may be cleansed, I offer incense.
May our recitation, generation and perfection phases, and experience and realisation increase!
May the four activities be spontaneously accomplished!
May the great pillar of the windhorse of the three kayas be erected!
May the wisdom of the four joys, bliss and emptiness, be aroused!
May the banner of universal victory be hoisted!
In the primordial expanse where all appearance and existence is pure from the very beginning,
May we all be liberated in one gathering into the dharmakaya!

groups.phonetics: Sarwa siddhi karma hishu hésu dzaya

groups.english: This abbreviation of the daily incense offering for Lungta was written by Longchen Yeshe Dorje for the benefit of future generations. May the four activities be spontaneously accomplished.
Incense offering prayer to increase Lungta
This incense offering, replete and sublime,
I offer as purification to the Buddha, Dharma and Sangha,
Lama, Yidam and Dakinis,
And to the Dharma Proctectors, wealth deities and treasure owners;
Please protect me and give refuge
Help me to increase my windhorse!
To the deities who dwell in the East,
The Drala who increases windhorse,
The Snow Lion of the Turquoise mane, to you,
Great Drala, heroic and splendid, I make this incense offering,
Please strengthen my windhorse,
And replenish it when it declines!
To the deities who dwell in the South,
The Drala who increase windhorse,
The Turquoise Dragon with talons of copper, to you,
Great Drala of the thunderous roar, I make this incense offering,
Please strengthen my windhorse,
And replenish it when it declines!
To the deities who dwell in the West,
The Drala who increases windhorse,
The Bengal Tiger with vermillion stripes, to you,
Great Drala, terrifying and heroic, I make this incense offering,
Please strengthen my windhorse,
And replenish it when it declines!
To the deities who dwell in the North,
The Drala who increase windhorse,
The Mighty Garuda with the jewelled crest, to you, Great Drala,
Endowed with tremendous power and force, I make this incense offering,
Please strengthen my windhorse,
And replenish it when it declines!
To the deities who dwell at the boundaries of the four directions,
To the Drala who increases windhorse,
And the deities of the five elements, to you I make this incense offering,
Please strengthen the windhorse of the elements,
And replenish it when it declines!
To the deities of (8 monograms of) divination, I offer this incense,
Please strengthen the windhorse of divination,
And replenish it when it declines!
To the deities of (the 9 signs of) astrology, I make this offering,
Please strengthen the windhorse of astrology,
And replenish it when it declines!
To the deities of years, months, dates and time, I offer this incense,
Please strengthen the windhorse of calendar time.
And replenish it when it declines!
To the principal deities and the deities of protection,
The male deities, female deities and shang deities,
The drak deities, lifeforce deities and body deities I offer this incense,
Please strengthen my windhorse,
And replenish it when it declines!
Lift my windhorse, raise it up!
Please render my body majestic and glorious!
Make my speech powerful, I pray!
Engender concentration in my mind I pray!
Pacify sickness and hindrances, increase lifespan and merit,
Gather all phenomena under your power and liberate all enemies
And obstacle makers! Hoist the victory banner in all directions!
Accomplish all our desired goals,
And fulfil the activities entrusted to you!
Victory! Victory! May the gods be victorious!
May the gods grant us victory! (be favourable to us)
Please utterly destroy every kind of demon and negative force,
And accomplish the enlightened activities entrusted to you!

groups.phonetics: Sarwa pidza yasiddhi sama yakün düsarwa dudu ho

groups.english: Anyone who recites this prayer to invoke windhorse and this precious mantra, or who writes it in Chinese ink and keeps it on their body will surely have their windhorse strengthened and lifespan and merit increased. For Dharma practitioners their qualities will grow and even for ordinary people their worldly aims will be accomplished, their commerce prosper and wishes be fulfilled.
The Abundant rain of nectar benefiting all
An offering of purifying incense to the local deities
Expanse of Bodhicitta, the luminosity of great bliss,
groups.phonetics: Kyé Déchen ösal changchup semkyi long

groups.english: The spontaneously arising universe and beings, the support and that which is supported,
Infinite purity free from discrimination,
And its self-radiance, the sublime generosity of compassion –
This incense feast of beneficial nectar –
We offer to the general guests, and specifically
To all the gods, nagas, ground owners,
Spirits of the eight classes, gods and ghosts, and those of unimaginable form dwelling in this region.
This sublime treasure of desirable objects which gratifies the senses
And bestows inexhaustible virtue and happiness, now and forever,
We offer as purification – may it always please you!
Never failing to help the inhabitants of this country
And us who are accomplishing enlightenment,
Protect us from harm due to disease, evil spirits, enemies, thieves and obstacle-makers,
And keep us provided with favourable conditions and all we need.
Hosts and guests in harmony keeping their promise,
By this feast free from discrimination between ‘me’ and ‘you,’
And by the power of doing together this Bodhisattva practice,
May we all attain enlightenment in one gathering.
This was written by Mangala, renowned as a son of the Buddhas, when the retreat center Thekchok Ösel Chöling was established in the valley of medicinal plants in Dordogne. May it be meaningful!
At the end, by way of conclusion, render everything positive and excellent by reciting these and other auspicious prayers:
May the victorious ones be pleased by this offering,
May the sacred link with the loyal protectors be restored,
May the desires of the six kinds of beings be satisfied,
May karmic debts and blood debts all be cleared.
May the two accumulations be perfected,
May the two obscurations and habitual tendencies be purified,
May the two supreme kayas be attained.
By the power of this vast gift
May I spontaneously attain buddhahood for the sake of all beings,
May all who have not been freed by past buddhas
Be now freed by this act of generosity.
May all spirits visiting this place,
All those who live on earth or in the air,
Always show goodwill to beings
And practise Dharma day and night.
By this positive action may all beings
Perfect the accumulation of merit and wisdom
And attain the two supreme kayas
Which arise from merit and wisdom.
Like the wish-fulfilling gem and tree of miracles,
May I, without the slightest effort,
Satisfy the hopes of beings
And fulfil their every wish.

There beings various ways, detailed and condensed, to do this practice, I, Jñana (Kyabje Dudjom Rinpoche), a decrepit old man and village yogi, wrote this according to my own liking in a condensed form for daily practice.
Prayer for peace in the world, and especially in Tibet
To the unfailing refuges, the Three Jewels and Three Roots,
And in particular to Avalokiteshvara, Protector of the Land of Snows,
To Noble Tara and Guru Padmasambhava,
We pray, remember the commitments you have made,
Bless us that our prayers may be fulfilled.
In this degenerate age, as a result of beings’ wrong attitudes and deeds,
And disturbances in the elements, outside and inside,
Humans and animals are stricken by previously unknown epidemics,
The influences of planetary forces, nagas, gyalpo spirits, demons, and evil jungpo spirits,
Failed crops due to blight, frost and hail, and armed conflicts.
The rain are irregular, and the marmots and birds in Tibet indicate bad omens,
Beings live in fear of the four elements, with earthquakes and wildfires,
And, in particular, foreign invasions and so on threaten the doctrine.
May all such harmful forces here in the Land of Snows
Be swiftly quelled and annihilated.
May the precious bodhichitta spontaneously arise
In the minds of all beings, human and nonhuman,
And may they be free of malicious thoughts and deeds.
May they think lovingly of one another,
So that the whole world enjoy peace and happiness
And the Buddha’s teachings spread and endure.
By the power of the truth of the Three Roots, of the buddhas and bodhisattvas,
And by the power of all sources of good in samsara and nirvana
And of our perfectly pure altruistic thoughts,
May the result of the prayer that we have made be accomplished.

The lord Guru Jamyang Khyentse Wangpo, because of his deep concern for all during these uncertain and greatly troubled times, would pray for the happiness of Tibet six times each day, and impressed upon Lodrö Thaye the importance of doing likewise. Accordingly the latter wrote this prayer as a personal reminder at Tsatra Rinchentak early one morning at an auspicious time when the moon was waxing in the Victory month. Artha siddhi rastu.
Dedication prayers
In order that all parent sentient beings throughout the furthest limits of the sky
May swiftly attain the total freedom and lasting happiness of Buddhahood,
The stream of all our accumulated merit, free from the concepts of the three wheels,
We dedicate without limit in the primordial expanse of emptiness.
In the Great Middle Way, the Two Bodies devoid of all concepts of the eight extremes;
In the Great Seal, the Three Bodies of the clear light union;
In the Great Perfection, the primordially pure, perfect ground free from all extremes;
In the Great, spontaneous, perfect exhaustion of all phenomena beyond concepts, we make this dedication.
Within the Absolute Body – fourth aspect beyond the three times, self-existing awareness –
Arises the infinite purity of everything that appears or exists, the deity’s form;
Awakening to the self-resounding empty sound of the eighty-four thousand teachings
May we realize primordial purity, timeless of the three times.
By the power of this merit, standing for all merit we have gained before or will yet gain,
With no concepts of a merit dedicated, its dedication, or to whom its dedicated,
May the obscurations of the three poisons be purified, perfecting the three realms as the Three Bodies;
May we simultaneously take the primordial province that is everlasting.
This prayer was made by Jñanavajra, a monk from Do, near Taksang Senge Samdrup at the time of a solar eclipse.
The action of the perfect abbot come from Zahor
And the view of Nagarjuna, glorious beyond compare,
Are joined and sealed within a single lineage.
May the doctrine of the Lake-Born Conqueror be spread.
Prayer for guidance
Champa Chökyi, display of Dorje Tso herself,
groups.phonetics: Om svasti Dorjé tso-nyi champa chökyi kar

groups.english: Residing among the dakinis in the Glorious Mountain,
Constantly take care of me and all of us,
Your host of devoted disciples, I pray
This prayer was written by Shakya gejong Ngawang Chökyi Lodrö. Siddhi rastu!
Long life prayers
In the celestial realm encircled by snow peaks,
You are the source of every happiness and benefit;
Tenzin Gyatso, Avalokitesvara in person,
May your lotus feet remain firm for a hundre aeons!

This prayer was first offered by Shabkar Tsogdruk Rangdrol for the long life of the Omniscient IXth Dalai Lama, Lungtog Gyatso, and with the appropriate name changes has been used throughout the successive incarnations of Dalai Lama. It is brief and concise for recitation by all, yet full of blessings.
Protector of the teaching and beings of Tibet, you who greatly elucidate
The path combining emptiness and compassion –
Ocean of Teaching Tenzin Gyatso, Padmapani holding a lotus in your hand,
To you I pray, may all your wishes spontaneously be fulfilled.

These lines appeared spontaneously in the mind of His Holiness the Dalai Lama after he was requested by Dilgo Khyentsé Rinpoché, the late head of the Nyingma School, to compose such a prayer for daily recital so that His Holiness’ wishes could be fulfilled.
Descendant of the divine lineage of Khön, magical emanation of Mañjusri Powerful Speech,
Filling all beings with joy, your activity sets the the path of Mahayana sutra and tantra
Ablaze in resplendent benefit and happiness;
Wish-fulfilling King, to you we pray: may your health and life stand firm!
Through the blessings of the fearless (Jigmé), infinite, radiant long life deities,
May the prophesied display of Khyenstse, the supreme powerful one (Nüden),
Be firm in health and life like the indestructible vajra,
And may his beneficial activity for the teachings and beings reach its ultimate extent!

This prayer for the health and long life of Khyentrul Rinpoche, body speech and mind son of the mighty learned and accomplished Kyabjé Kangyur Rinpoche, was left as an aspiration, written down and offered by the totally ignorant Buddhist monk known as Ngawang Chökyi Lodrö at Tashi Pelbar Ling in France on the auspicious twenty-second day of the Ripening (tenth) Month of the Earth Hare Year. Jayantu!
Through dependant causation and the blessings of the infinity of long life deities,
May Pema Wangyal, prophesied magical emanation of the Taklung Tsetrul,
Be firm in body, speech and mind like the King of the Sounding Drum (Amitabha),
And may the great waves of his wishes for the teachings and beings spread out to their ultimate extent!

This prayer for the health and long life of the supreme refuge Pema Wangyal Rinpoche, body speech and mind son of the mighty learned and accomplished Kyabjé Kangyur Rinpoche, was felt as an aspiration, written down and offered by the totally ignorant Buddhist monk known as Ngawang Chökyi Lodrö at Tashi Pelbar Ling in France on the auspicious twenty-second day of the Ripening (tenth) Month of the Earth Hare Year. Virtue!
Through the power of truth of the infinite Three Roots and long life deities,
groups.phonetics: Om svasti Thayé tsasum tsélhé dentop kyi

groups.english: May he who Khyentse proclaimed to be the emanation of Namnying Tsalo,
Gyurmé Rinchen Tendzin, be firm in health and life,
And his munificience for the benefit and happiness of beings ever increase!

This prayer for the health and long life of the supreme refuge Rangdrol Rinpoche, body speech and mind son of the mighty learned and accomplished Kyabjé Kangyur Rinpoche, was felt as an aspiration, written down and offered by the totally ignorant Buddhist monk known as Ngawang Chökyi Lodrö at Tashi Pelbar Ling in France on the auspicious twenty-second day of the Ripening (tenth) Month of the Earth Hare Year. Shubham!
Through the perfect health and life of the glorious masters,
Through the increasing prosperity of the patrons of the Doctrine,
Through the raising of the jeweled victory banner of the undeclining dominion of the Dharma,
May the doctrine of the Lake-Born Conqueror be spread.
May bodhicitta, precious and sublime,
Arise where it has not yet come to be.
And where it has arisen, may it never fail
But grow and flourish ever more and more.
In the world in general and in this country
May not even the names of disease, famine, war or other sufferings be heard.
May spiritual practice, merit and prosperity ever increase,
And may there be continuous good fortune, well-being and sublime happiness.
May the tradition of three great beings – Khenpo Shantarakshita, Lopön Padmasambhawa and Dharma king Trisongdetsen –
Spread throughout the three levels of this world.
May sentient beings never be separate from the Three Jewels,
And thus live in perfect goodness throughout the three times.
May the tradition of Jamyang Khentsé Wangpo, who is the master of the ocean-like Rimé teachings of Tibet,
The lord who wields the wonderful Seven Special Direct Blessings,
And Mañjushri himself in person,
Spread, prosper and grow!
